name: Krakow
fun_fact: Fun fact: Krakow is the birthplace of the bagel (obwarzanek krakowski) and was Poland's capital for over 500 years - it escaped WWII virtually undestroyed, preserving its medieval beauty when Warsaw was leveled.

hero_dishes.name: Pierogi
hero_dishes.description: Dumplings stuffed with potato and cheese (ruskie), meat, sauerkraut and mushrooms, or sweet fillings - Poland's national dish
hero_dishes.origin_story: Pierogi are to Poland what pasta is to Italy - fundamental. Each filling has meaning: ruskie (Russian-style with potato and cheese) is most popular, meat for hearty meals, sauerkraut and mushrooms for Christmas Eve. Families gather to fold hundreds together, and everyone has their grandmother's recipe that's 'the best.'
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Pierogarnia Krakowiacy (traditional Polish dining - arrive at noon when they open or face long lines out the door), Przypiecek (one of few 24-hour Krakow restaurants, 20 different types), Wrga Pub (fries their pierogi to perfection - order the 27-piece platter with 3 kinds)

hero_dishes.name: Zapiekanka
hero_dishes.description: Long baguette topped with saut茅ed mushrooms, cheese, and ketchup - Poland's 1970s fast food answer
hero_dishes.origin_story: Born in communist Poland's 1970s as quick, affordable food before McDonald's arrived. The Plac Nowy market square in Kazimierz (Jewish Quarter) became zapiekanka central - vendors compete with secret sauces and creative toppings. It's street food elevated to Krakow tradition.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Plac Nowy market square (Kazimierz - iconic zapiekanka stalls, each with secret sauce), Zapieksy King, Bar Mleczny Plac Nowy, Zapiekanki BarOko (try 'Niebo w Gebie' - sausage, tomato, sheep cheese, spring onion, mushrooms, spicy sauce), Bar Namaxa

hero_dishes.name: Obwarzanek Krakowski
hero_dishes.description: Twisted, chewy bread rings sprinkled with poppy seeds, sesame seeds, or salt - Krakow's 14th-century bagel ancestor
hero_dishes.origin_story: These rings pre-date the bagel and have been sold on Krakow streets since the 14th century. Legend says Jewish immigrants took this recipe to New York, creating the modern bagel. The twist pattern and boiling before baking are techniques that crossed the Atlantic. It's living culinary history.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Blue carts around Rynek G贸wny (Main Square) and Wawel Castle - sold by older vendors from little blue-framed stalls, particularly good heated with butter

hero_dishes.name: 呕urek
hero_dishes.description: Sour rye soup with sausage, hard-boiled egg, and potatoes, often served in an edible bread bowl
hero_dishes.origin_story: This ancient Polish soup has a fermented rye base that gives it distinctive sour tang. Traditionally eaten at Easter but available year-round in Krakow. The combination of sour broth, smoky sausage, and creamy egg creates complex, satisfying flavors that warm you from inside.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Bar Mleczny pod Temida (centrally located Old Town - great 呕urek), U Babci Maliny (favorite restaurant in Krakow), traditional milk bars

signature_drinks.name: 呕ubr贸wka (Bison Grass Vodka)
signature_drinks.description: Vodka flavored with bison grass from Biaowie偶a Forest - smooth, slightly sweet, with vanilla notes
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Often mixed with apple juice to make 'Tatanka' or 'Szarlotka' (apple pie shot). The bison grass gives subtle sweetness. It's distinctly Polish - the grass grows only in protected ancient forest where Europe's last wild bison roam.

signature_drinks.name: Polish Beer
signature_drinks.description: Tyskie, 呕ywiec, Okocim - local lagers that are point of regional pride
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Served cold at pubs and restaurants. Beer culture in Poland is serious but casual - locals drink it with meals and while socializing. Cheaper than Western Europe, quality is excellent.

food_culture_notes: Krakow literally invented the bagel - obwarzanek krakowski dates to the 1300s, centuries before bagels appeared in America
Plac Nowy in Kazimierz is zapiekanka central - the stalls compete for 'best' status with creative toppings and secret sauces
Arrive at popular pierogi restaurants right when they open (noon) or expect to wait in line
Kiebaski z Niebieskiej Nyski - family-run stand with blue van near Kazimierz serves legendary grilled kielbasa 7 PM-midnight
